Module c486.c486assessmentproject
Package Controller

Class MainFormController

java.lang.Object
Controller.MainFormController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainFormController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the MainFormController class that implements Initializable which populates both parts and products tables with test data.
This is the starting point of the program and has buttons that lead to all the other forms of the program.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    exitProgram(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method executes the program once the exit button is pressed or returns to main form if the no button is pressed.
    void
    getPartSearchResults()
    This method extracts the input from the search field and calls the lookUpPart method from the Inventory class and searches through the array list for a match and returns the results to the partTable.
    If no results are found an error message is displayed saying no results are found.
    void
    initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
    The initialize method that will be called first when the main form opens.
    This method handles setting the table's data to the allParts and allProducts array lists contents.
    void
    onDeletePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method grabs the selected part's data and deletes it.
    It will confirm with the user before deletion of part as well as displaying an error message if no part is selected or if the part was not deleted.
    void
    onProductSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method extracts the input from the search text field and calls the lookUpProduct method from the Inventory class and searches through the array list for a match and returns results to the productTable.
    If no results are found an error message is displayed saying no results are found.
    void
    toAddParts(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method opens the add parts screen if the add parts button is clicked.
    void
    toAddProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method opens the add product page if the add product button is clicked.
    void
    toDeleteProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method grabs the selected product's data and deletes it.
    It will confirm with the user before deleting the product as well as displaying an error message if no product is selected or if the product was not deleted.
    void
    toModifyParts(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method opens the modify parts screen if the modify parts button is clicked, and handles sending the selected part's data into the modify parts screen.
    An error message is displayed if the user clicks the modify part button without selecting a part to be modified first.
    void
    toModifyProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method opens the modify product page if the modify product button is clicked, and handles sending the selected product's data into the modify product screen.
    An error message is displayed if the user clicks the modify product button without selecting a product to be modified first.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      The initialize method that will be called first when the main form opens.
      This method handles setting the table's data to the allParts and allProducts array lists contents.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -

    • getPartSearchResults

      public void getPartSearchResults() throws NumberFormatException
      This method extracts the input from the search field and calls the lookUpPart method from the Inventory class and searches through the array list for a match and returns the results to the partTable.
      If no results are found an error message is displayed saying no results are found.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException

    • toAddParts

      public void toAddParts(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method opens the add parts screen if the add parts button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - Add part button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • toModifyParts

      public void toModifyParts(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method opens the modify parts screen if the modify parts button is clicked, and handles sending the selected part's data into the modify parts screen.
      An error message is displayed if the user clicks the modify part button without selecting a part to be modified first.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - Modify part button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • toAddProduct

      public void toAddProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method opens the add product page if the add product button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - Add product button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • toModifyProduct

      public void toModifyProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method opens the modify product page if the modify product button is clicked, and handles sending the selected product's data into the modify product screen.
      An error message is displayed if the user clicks the modify product button without selecting a product to be modified first.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - Modify product button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - - NullPointerException if a product isn't selected first before modify product button is clicked.

    • onDeletePart

      public void onDeletePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method grabs the selected part's data and deletes it.
      It will confirm with the user before deletion of part as well as displaying an error message if no part is selected or if the part was not deleted.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - Delete part button is pressed.

    • onProductSearch

      public void onProductSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method extracts the input from the search text field and calls the lookUpProduct method from the Inventory class and searches through the array list for a match and returns results to the productTable.
      If no results are found an error message is displayed saying no results are found.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - Enter key is pressed when focus is on the search text field.

    • toDeleteProduct

      public void toDeleteProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method grabs the selected product's data and deletes it.
      It will confirm with the user before deleting the product as well as displaying an error message if no product is selected or if the product was not deleted.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - Delete product button is clicked.

    • exitProgram

      public void exitProgram(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method executes the program once the exit button is pressed or returns to main form if the no button is pressed.
      Parameters:
      event - - Exit button is clicked.
